chapter.para: This chapter is full of little examples of markup that we may want to use. If you need more than the markup listed here, please ask me. My intent was to spare you from from having to read-up on DocBook.

Here we show how to create true hyperlinks to resources on the web, such as Google or a plain URL without alternative text

Now, we will forward-reference a figure which is later on (a forward reference) . Note that when doing such a reference, it is best to target something which had a "title" element, as that will become the display text for your link. Note also it is good writing practice to never use positional text (i.e. "the figure below" or "the figure on the next page") as you do not know where the images will ultimatly be placed relative to the text.
